results.title_name_tc: 交銀信託提供之保單信託服務
results.content_en:
1. Steps in establishing policy trust with Bank Comm/Life Administration
Clients can proceed with 2 methods of setting up policy trust after attending sales
interview at the Bank of Communications Trustee Company (refer to item 4.2). Either
name the Trustee as the Beneficiary or using Absolute Assignment to pass the policy
ownership to the Trustee. It is the responsibility of BOCT staff to advise which
method is more suitable to the clients.
1.1 Using Absolute Assignment
- Policies must be issued after reasonable time (3 weeks preferred) before
approaching any clients for trustee applications.
a) Sign trust application with Bank of Communications Trustee (thereafter
shortened as "BOCT")
b) Obtain confirmation with BOCT by issuing Trust Deeds, usually around 3 -4
weeks.
c) Agents will be notified by BOCT and should prepare the policy change form,
i.e. Absolute Assignment Form with Policyowner's signature to Prudential
accordingly, pending attachments as specified in item 3 below. The workflow
shall follow the existing practice as set forth by Life Administration.
d) The required documents (see item 3 below) will be submitted by BOCT to Life
Administration and the Company reserves the right to call for additional
documents for incomplete cases.
e) Upon completion, Company will issue confirmation notices to the Assignee and
the Assignor (with cc copy to agent).
f) Future correspondence will be sent to the Assignee, ie. the Trustee Co. instead
of original Policyowner (i.e. the Settlor) subsequent to the confirmation.
1.2 Using beneficiary appointment
- Policies must be issued after reasonable time (3 weeks preferred) before
approaching any clients for trustee applications.
a) Sign trust application with Bank of Communications Trustee (thereafter
shortened as "BOCT")
b) Obtain confirmation with BOCT by issuing Trust Deeds, usually around 3 -4
weeks.
c) Agents will be notified by BOCT and should prepare the policy change form,
i.e. Beneficiary Appointment Form with Policyowner's signature to
Prudential accordingly, pending attachments as specified in item 3 below. The
workflow shall follow the existing practice as set forth by Life Administration.
Version: Dec 12, 2007 (Final)

results.title_name_en: PRUwealth Serier - Application Form for Policy Surrender / Withdrawal of Cash Value of Policy Account
results.title_name_tc: 盈利寶系列-退保/提取保單戶口之現金價值申請表格
results.content_en:
er and withdrawal of cash value within the first 5 policy years. 以下提取費用適用於首5個
保單年之退保及保單戶口現金價值提取:
● Within 1st year 第一年內 - 8%
● Within 2nd year 第二年內 - 6%
● Within 3rd year 第三年內 - 4%
●
Within 4th year 第四年內 - 2%
● Within 5th year 第五年內 - 1%
5. If no reason selected for policy cancellation, it would be considered as "Unwilling to disclose reason". 如沒有選擇相關申請原因,將被視為「不願意
披露理由」。
00000000
Prudential Hong Kong Limited 保誠保險有限公司
Part of Prudential plc (United Kingdom) 保誠集團成員
PDD/PAIPPW (06/25)
1/5
PAIPPW0401Part 1 第一部分 Policy Surrender / Withdrawal of Cash Value 退保/提取現金價值指示
I understand and consent that after deducting all other relevant redemption charges as listed above (if applicable), the surrender value / policy account value
will be reduced by the percentage of MVA based on the receipt date of this fully completed form with the required supporting documents by Prudential. I further
understand that the MVA, when applied, reduces the surrender value / policy account value to reflect the market value movement
of the underlying assets of the captioned policy. 本人明白及同意在扣除上表所列之提取費用後(如適用),退保價值/保單戶口價值須減去有關
市場價值調整金額,該金額將以保誠收到此完全填妥表格及相關文件當日之百分比計算;本人並明白保誠行使市場價值調整將會調低
退保價值/保單戶口價值,從而反映有關保單旗下資產的變動。
Requested Effective Date # :
要求生效日期:
Day 日
/
/
Month 月
Year年
# Leave this blank unless you have specific request on the effective date of
change. Prudential shall have the right to determine the effective date of
change upon acceptance of the Application. 如對更改生效日期沒有特別
要求,不用填寫此欄。於接受更改申請時,保誠有權決定更改之
生效日期。
Withdraw Cash Value of Policy Account (Cheque Amount) 提取保單戶口現金價值(支票金額)
USD/HKD 美元 /港元
Surrender 退保
Reason for Surrender (Please choose ONE appropriate answer) 申請退保原因(請選擇一個最適當的答案)
Change in Insurance needs 保險需求有所改變
Change in financial condition 財務狀況改變
Replaced by another insurance plan 以其他保險產品取代
Returns below expectations 保單回報未如理想
Coverage not comprehensive 保障不夠全面
Payment tenor is too long 付款期過長
Urgent need of Money 急需用錢
Lost confidence in the economy and future 對前景及經濟失去信心
Residing overseas 移居外地
Other Reason 其他理由
Unwilling to disclose reason 不願意披露理由
Part 2 第二部分 Payment Instruction 付款指示
1. All payments would be issued by cheque and in the name of the policyowner. For policy with collateral assignment, please state the payee of the cheque.
所有款項將以支票直接給予保單持有人。如保單已作抵押轉讓,請指示支票抬頭人。
2. If no payment option is selected, payment will be issued in HKD cheque. 如沒有選擇付款方式,款項會以港元支票簽發。
3. The cheque will be posted to the policyowner's correspondence address in Prudential's by registered mail, unless otherwise specify in the "Delivery Option"
below. 除在以下註明遞交方式,支票將會以掛號形式郵寄到保單持有人在保誠記錄上的通訊地址。
4. If the policyowner selects to collect the cheque at a branch of Standard Chartered Bank (Hong Kong) Limited (SCB) or at our Customer Service Centre(CSC),
please specify the SCB branch code, or the CSC location and policyowner's contact number. 如選擇到渣打銀行(香港)有限公司分行或本公司客戶
服務中心領取,請註明分行編號,或客戶服務中心地點及保單持有人聯絡號碼。
Payment Option 付款方式
HKD Cheque 港元支票
(Applicable to USD / HKD Policy 適用於美元及港元保單)
Local USD Cheque 本地美元支票
(Applicable to USD Policy 適用於美元保單)
Overseas USD Cheque 海外美元支票
(Applicable to USD Policy 適用於美元保單)
For Policy with collateral assignee, please state the payee of the cheque 如保單已作抵押轉讓,請指示支票收款人
Policyowner 保單持有人
Collateral Assignee 抵押轉讓之承讓人
Delivery Option 遞交方式
Posted to Policyowner's correspondence address in our record. 郵寄到保單持有人在本公司記錄上的通訊地址
Collect at SCB Branch 親身到渣打銀行分行領取
Approved by BM / BSM:
Branch Code 分行編號
Policyowner's contact number 保單持有人聯絡號碼:
Collect at Prudential Customer Service Centre 親身到保誠客戶服務中心領取
Location 地點:
Policyowner's contact number 保單持有人聯絡號碼:
Signing No.
2/5
PAIPPW0402
00000000
PDD/PAIPPW (06/25)

5. If no reason selected for policy cancellation, it would be considered as "Unwilling to disclose reason". 如沒有選擇相關申請原因,將被視為「不願意
披露理由」。

Prudential Hong Kong Limited 保誠保險有限公司

I understand and consent that after deducting all other relevant redemption charges as listed above (if applicable), the surrender value / policy account value
will be reduced by the percentage of MVA based on the receipt date of this fully completed form with the required supporting documents by Prudential. I further
understand that the MVA, when applied, reduces the surrender value / policy account value to reflect the market value movement
of the underlying assets of the captioned policy. 本人明白及同意在扣除上表所列之提取費用後(如適用),退保價值/保單戶口價值須減去有關
市場價值調整金額,該金額將以保誠收到此完全填妥表格及相關文件當日之百分比計算;本人並明白保誠行使市場價值調整將會調低
退保價值/保單戶口價值,從而反映有關保單旗下資產的變動。

results.title_name_en: Means of Premium Payment (For Macau branch)
results.title_name_tc: 付款形式 (適用於澳門分行)
results.content_en:
繳費辦法 Payment Instructions
請使用下列辦法直接繳付費用。港元保單只接受港元/澳門元付款。外幣保單可接受以保單貨幣或港元/澳門元付款。非港元保單之付款貨幣受個別繳費方法之條款及細則所規限。
請參閱各繳費方法可接受的付款貨幣。若 閣下以港元/澳門元支付外幣保單及以非支票方式付款,交易金額將按交易日適用的匯率折算為保單貨幣等值金額結算。若 閣下以港元
支票付款,將按保誠收到支票當日的適用匯率換算成保單貨幣的等值金額結算。請瀏覽prudential.com.hk/exchange-rates-mac以獲取不同貨幣的現行匯率。為保障 閣下的利益,
繳付費用時, 閣下不應該將現金轉交或轉賬至 閣下的理財顧問。與此同時,請參閱本公司網頁所刊登之私隱政策。
Please make payments to us directly using the payment methods listed below. For HKD policies, payments can only be made in HKD/MOP. For policies denominated in foreign currencies, payments
can be made in either the policy currency or HKD/MOP. The payment currency of non-HKD policies is subject to the terms and conditions of the individual payment methods. Please refer to the
acceptable payment currencies for each payment method. If you pay for a foreign currency policy in HKD/MOP by non-cheque payment, the transaction amount will be settled at the applicable
exchange rate on the transaction date and converted into the equivalent amount of policy currency. If you pay by cheque in HKD, the transaction amount will be settled at the applicable exchange
rate at on the day of receipt by Prudential and converted into the equivalent amount of policy currency. Please visit prudential.com.hk/exchange-rates-mac-en for our prevailing exchange rate in
different currencies. To protect your interest, you should not pass cash or transfer funds to your financial consultant when making payment. In addition, please visit our privacy policy published in our
corporate website.
3 自動轉賬 Autopay^
閣下可以設立銀行戶口自動轉賬或更改
自動轉賬戶口繳費。請
● 聯絡 閣下之理財顧問或
● 於 www.prudential.com.mo
(澳門>下載中心>更改保單付款
資料)下載的銀行戶口直接付款授權
書(澳門適用)
由於設立自動轉賬需時21天,請將授權
書及預繳保費的支票郵寄至本公司辦理
相關手續(地址:澳門郵政總局郵政信
箱3093號)。
You can set up a bank account autopay or change
autopay account to settle payment. Please
· contact your financial consultant or
· visit www.prudential.com.mo
(Macau > Download library > Update of
Policy Payment Details) for downloading
appropriate Bank Account Direct Debit
Authorization Form (for Macau).
As it takes 21 days to set up the direct debit
authorization, please send the form and the
cheque for advanced payment to us by mail for
processing (Address: P.O. Box 3093, General Post
Office, Macau).
$
電滙 Telegraphic Transfer
您可以使用電匯以保單貨幣 ** 匯款至 You may pay premium by telegraphic transfer
相應貨幣的銀行戶口繳交保費。請預 in policy currency ** to the bank account in
留至少七個工作天以處理有關款項。 the corresponding currency. Please allow
詳情請聯絡 閣下的理財顧問或前往 at least seven working days for processing
pruhk.co/payment-mac-tt °
the premium payment. For details, please
contact your financial consultant or visit
pruhk.co/payment-mac-tt-en.
?其他繳款辦法 Other Payment Instructions
請瀏覽 www.prudential.com.mo 以了解詳情。
Please visit www.prudential.com.mo for details.
親臨繳費處付款 Payment in person at cashier # ▲
閣下可攜同繳費通知書前往本公司之繳費 You can bring along the Premium Notice and
處以下列方法付款。
make payment at our cashier using one of the
following methods.
現金
每份保單每期繳費的交易金額上限為
120,000港元/123,700澳門元/15,000美元
或等值。為保障您的利益,繳付費用時,
您不應該將現金轉交或轉賬至您的理財顧
問。如您欲以現金繳費,建議親臨本公司
繳費處直接辦理。
Cash
Maximum HKD 120,000 / MOP 123,700 /
USD 15,000 or equivalent per payment
installment per policy. To protect your interest,
you should not pass cash or transfer funds
to your financial consultant when making
payment. If you prefer to pay in cash, you
should pay directly at our cashier.
劃線支票/銀行本票/匯票 **
只接受澳門本地銀行發出的港元*劃線支
票/銀行本票/匯票繳費,抬頭請寫上「保
誠保險有限公司」。如閣下於過去12個
月曾使用銀行本票/匯票支付保費及累計
金額超過120,000港元或以上,須付上相
關的資金來源證明文件。有關資金來源証
明文件的詳情,請聯絡您的理財顧問或致
電客戶服務熱線。保誠保留權利以要求客
戶提供有關證明文件。
Crossed cheque/cashier order/bank draft **
Only accept HKD* crossed Cheque/cashier
order/bank draft issued by banks in Macau
made payable to "Prudential Hong Kong
Limited". If you have paid premium by cashier
order/bank draft in the past 12 months and the
total amount exceeds HKD 120,000 or above,
relevant supporting documents for the source
of funds must be provided. Please contact your
financial consultant or call our customer service
hotline for details of the supporting documents.
Prudential reserves the right to request for the
related supporting documents from customers.
信用卡/銀聯卡
請注意,本公司不接受以信用卡/銀聯卡繳
付「續保保費」、「保單更改」、「償還
貸款」及「在保單保費儲蓄戶口的預繳保
費」。
Credit Card/UnionPay Card
Please note that we do not accept payment
by credit card for "Renewal Premium", "Policy
Change", "Loan Repayment" and "Advance
Premium into Premium Deposit Account
(PDA)".
保誠可能隨時更改繳費安排而毋須事先通知。詳情請瀏覽本公司網頁。
Prudential may change payment arrangement anytime without prior notice. For details,
please visit our corporate website.
註 Note:
*
請預留三個工作天予本公司處理有關付款。Please allow 3 working days for payment processing.
** 付款貨幣受個別計劃之條款及細則所規限。Currency for payment is subject to the terms and conditions of individual product.
# 恕不接受以海外支票/銀行本票/匯票繳費。Making payment via overseas cheque/cashier's order/bank draft is not accepted.
▲ 由第三者付款的繳費方式恕不獲接受,除非付款人為保單持有人之直系親屬或指定人士類別,並連同付款人及保單持有人所簽署的「第三者付款聲明書」一併提交。如第
三者款項超過指定金額,第三者付款人必須遞交相關的證明文件。Payment by a third party is not accepted unless the payor is an immediate family member of the policyowner or
person(s) in the specified categories, and the payment is submitted together with a "Third Party Payment Declaration Form" signed by both the payor and the policyowner. If the third party
payment is over designated amount, the payor has to submit the related supporting documents.
(10 / 2024)

請使用下列辦法直接繳付費用。港元保單只接受港元/澳門元付款。外幣保單可接受以保單貨幣或港元/澳門元付款。非港元保單之付款貨幣受個別繳費方法之條款及細則所規限。
請參閱各繳費方法可接受的付款貨幣。若 閣下以港元/澳門元支付外幣保單及以非支票方式付款,交易金額將按交易日適用的匯率折算為保單貨幣等值金額結算。若 閣下以港元
支票付款,將按保誠收到支票當日的適用匯率換算成保單貨幣的等值金額結算。請瀏覽prudential.com.hk/exchange-rates-mac以獲取不同貨幣的現行匯率。為保障 閣下的利益,
繳付費用時, 閣下不應該將現金轉交或轉賬至 閣下的理財顧問。與此同時,請參閱本公司網頁所刊登之私隱政策。
Please make payments to us directly using the payment methods listed below. For HKD policies, payments can only be made in HKD/MOP. For policies denominated in foreign currencies, payments
can be made in either the policy currency or HKD/MOP. The payment currency of non-HKD policies is subject to the terms and conditions of the individual payment methods. Please refer to the
acceptable payment currencies for each payment method. If you pay for a foreign currency policy in HKD/MOP by non-cheque payment, the transaction amount will be settled at the applicable
exchange rate on the transaction date and converted into the equivalent amount of policy currency. If you pay by cheque in HKD, the transaction amount will be settled at the applicable exchange
rate at on the day of receipt by Prudential and converted into the equivalent amount of policy currency. Please visit prudential.com.hk/exchange-rates-mac-en for our prevailing exchange rate in
different currencies. To protect your interest, you should not pass cash or transfer funds to your financial consultant when making payment. In addition, please visit our privacy policy published in our
corporate website.

make payment at our cashier using one of the

現金

results.title_name_en: Addition/Increase of Regular Top-up Premium (RTU) / Addition of Lump Sum Top-up Premium
results.title_name_tc: 附加/增加定期額外投資保費或附加一次過額外投資保費
results.content_en:
PRUDENTIAL
英 國 保 誠
From :
Anthony Shaw
Date :
8 December, 2014
To :
All Financial Consultants
CC :
Regional Managers & up, Senior Managers & up
Re :
Withdrawal of ILAS Products
To help protect the rights of customers and ensure that the quality of ILAS business issued by the Hong Kong
insurance industry is as high as possible, the Office of the Commissioner of Insurance (OCI) has issued a
Guidance Note on Underwriting Class C Business (GN15), which will be effective on 1 January 2015. The
major scope of GN15 includes requiring a minimum death benefit of 105% of the account value, ensuring fees
and charges are fair to customers and remuneration structure is appropriate with proper disclosure.
Our current ILAS products do not conform to the new standards contained in GN15. In view of this, the
Company will withdraw the following products with effect from 1 January 2015 i.e. these products will be
removed from the PRUcompass on 1 January 2015:
· PRUlink investment plan(PLIP)
PRUretirement extra(RP3)
· PRUkid extra(KIDS2)
· PRUlink optimiser plus(POP2)
PRUlink investlife(IL1)
· Investment Plus (INVP)
Please note, PRUlink capital investment plan (PCI) is in compliance with the new regulatory requirements and
will continue to be available for sale on or after 1 January 2015.
To comply with the new regulatory requirements, please note that all completed applications* for PLIP,
RP3, KIDS2, POP2, IL1 and any traditional plans attached with INVP must reach the Cashier Office no
later than 16:00 on 31 December 2014 (the last submission date). All New Business premium and
outstanding supporting documents (if any) must be submitted as soon as possible for policy issue. The
Company will cancel all unsuccessful applications by 31 January 2015 (the last issue date).
For any addition of INVP rider, the completed application* must reach relevant PA Drop-In Box before
14:00 on 31 December 2014 (the last submission date). All outstanding premiums and documents (if any)
must be submitted as soon as possible for company approval. The Company will cancel all unsuccessful
applications by 31 January 2015 (the last issue date).
* Complete application means:
(1) Application Form / Application for Change in Policy and all other relevant application documents are properly signed and
completed; and
(2) Sales illustration must be printed and duly signed on or before 31 December 2014.
To meet customer demand for ILAS products, PLIP and POP2 will be revamped and the new products will be
available in January 2015 subject to regulatory approval. Details will be announced later.
Best regards,
Anthony Shaw
Chief Officer, Marketing & Customer Service

A. Deletion of Insured Person(s) 減除受保人
(Application is only allowed at renewal. Please make sure that this form is received by us 1 month before the renewal date.)

handling fee of HK$ 100 shall be charged for each cheque reissuance.
在未有就賠償指定銀行戶口時,將只會向保單持有人發出賠償支票。如有遺失賠償支票,保單持有人請以書面通知本公司。本公司將為每張補發支票收取HK$100行政費。
3. For changing direct debit account premium settlement, please fill in the Payment Details Amendment Form.
如欲更改以自動轉賬繳付保費的銀行戶口號碼,請另填更改付款資料申請表。

results.content_en:
may temporarily suspend your regular premium payments. It does not mean that
you are only required to make premium contribution during the initial contribution period.
保費假期指閣下可在該期間暫時停止定期保費供款,但並不表示閣下只須在最初的供款期內繳付保費。
(b) As all relevant fees and charges will continue to be deducted from your ILAS policy value during the premium
holiday, the value of your ILAS policy may be significantly reduced.
由於在保費假期內所有費用及收費仍會繼續從閣下的投連壽險保單價值中扣除,因此,閣下的投連壽險保單價值或
會因此而大幅減少。
LAXX/IFS_C_TU-B (11/23)
00000000
DATTUP0602PRUDENTIAL
保 誠 保 險
Prudential Hong Kong Limited
Part of Prudential plc (United Kingdom)
保誠保險有限公司
保誠集團成員
TOP-UP
B
(7)
Risk of Early Termination: Your ILAS policy may be automatically early terminated and you could lose all your premiums
paid and benefits accrued if any condition of automatic early termination is triggered. This may happen if you fail to make
premium contribution (for regular premium payment), or if your policy has very low or negative value (e.g. poor investment
performance, exercise of premium holiday), etc. For details, please refer to the product documents of this ILAS policy.
提早終止的風險:若有任何啟動保單自動提早終止的情況出現,閣下的投連壽險保單或會被自動提早終止,而閣下亦會因此
損失所有已繳付的保費及累算權益。此可能啟動保單自動提早終止的情況包括:閣下未能定期支付保費,或閣下的保單價值
處於十分低或負數的水平(例如:投資表現不理想或於行使保費假期後等)。詳情可參閱此投連壽險保單的產品資料文件。
(8)
Licensed Insurance Intermediaries' Remuneration: If you pay top-up premium(s), for each HK$100 of the premium
that you pay, the licensed insurance broker will on average receive remuneration of:
持牌保險中介人的酬勞:若閣下選擇繳交額外投資保費,以閣下每繳付$100 港元保費金額計,持牌保險經紀將會獲取
平均酬勞如下:
Top-up premium option
額外投資保費選擇
Average remuneration per $100 premium paid
以每繳付 100元保費金額計的平均酬勞
For PRUkid series and
PRUretirement series
適用於俊傑系列及退休寶系列
For other ILAS Policy
(Included Traditional Policy with
Investment Plus)
適用於其他投連壽險保單
(包括附有「投資寶」的傳統壽險保單)
Lump sum top-up premium
一次過額外投資保費
HK$5.5 港元
HK$6.0 港元
Regular top-up premium
定期額外投資保費
HK$5.5 港元
HK$6.0 港元
(Delete wherever inapplicable 如不適用請刪除)
The remuneration is an average figure calculated on the assumption that you will pay the lump sum top-up premium / all the
regular top-up premiums throughout the entire premium payment period. It covers all payments to the licensed insurance
broker directly attributable to the top-up premium payment (including upfront and future commissions, bonuses and other
incentives).
For regular top-up premium option, the amount of remuneration actually receivable by the licensed insurance broker may vary
from year to year and is higher in the first year of the regular top-up premium payment. In addition, as this top-up premium
option involves whole-life premium payment, a 30-year period has been adopted for calculating both the total premiums and
the total remuneration.
You are entitled to make enquiry with your licensed insurance broker if you wish to know more about the remuneration that he/
she may receive in respect of this policy.
持牌保險經紀的酬勞是基於閣下會繳付一次過額外投資保費/整個供款期內所有定期額外投資保費的假設下,計算所得的平均
值。該酬勞包括所有直接因所繳付的額外投資保費而向持牌保險經紀支付的款項(包括前期及其後的佣金、花紅及其他獎金)。
就定期額外投資保費選擇而言,持牌保險經紀每年實際上可獲取的酬勞金額可能有所不同,而酬勞金額於繳付定期額外投資保
費的首年會較高。此外,此項額外投資保費選擇涉及終生保費供款,計算時總保費及總酬勞金額時採用三十年為供款期的假設。
如果閣下希望進一步了解閣下的持牌保險經紀就此保單可能取得的酬勞,閣下有權向該持牌保險經紀查詢。
I ("Policyowner") confirm that I have read and understood and agree to be bound by paragraphs above.
本人(“保單持有人”)現確認已閱讀及明白,並同意受以上各段之約束。

處於十分低或負數的水平(例如:投資表現不理想或於行使保費假期後等)。詳情可參閱此投連壽險保單的產品資料文件。
(8)
Licensed Insurance Intermediaries' Remuneration: If you pay top-up premium(s), for each HK$100 of the premium
that you pay, the licensed insurance broker will on average receive remuneration of:
持牌保險中介人的酬勞:若閣下選擇繳交額外投資保費,以閣下每繳付$100 港元保費金額計,持牌保險經紀將會獲取
平均酬勞如下:
Top-up premium option
額外投資保費選擇
Average remuneration per $100 premium paid
以每繳付 100元保費金額計的平均酬勞
For PRUkid series and
PRUretirement series
適用於俊傑系列及退休寶系列
For other ILAS Policy
(Included Traditional Policy with
Investment Plus)
適用於其他投連壽險保單
(包括附有「投資寶」的傳統壽險保單)
Lump sum top-up premium
一次過額外投資保費
HK$5.5 港元
HK$6.0 港元
Regular top-up premium
定期額外投資保費
HK$5.5 港元
HK$6.0 港元
(Delete wherever inapplicable 如不適用請刪除)
The remuneration is an average figure calculated on the assumption that you will pay the lump sum top-up premium / all the
regular top-up premiums throughout the entire premium payment period. It covers all payments to the licensed insurance
broker directly attributable to the top-up premium payment (including upfront and future commissions, bonuses and other
incentives).
For regular top-up premium option, the amount of remuneration actually receivable by the licensed insurance broker may vary
from year to year and is higher in the first year of the regular top-up premium payment. In addition, as this top-up premium
option involves whole-life premium payment, a 30-year period has been adopted for calculating both the total premiums and
the total remuneration.
You are entitled to make enquiry with your licensed insurance broker if you wish to know more about the remuneration that he/
she may receive in respect of this policy.
持牌保險經紀的酬勞是基於閣下會繳付一次過額外投資保費/整個供款期內所有定期額外投資保費的假設下,計算所得的平均
值。該酬勞包括所有直接因所繳付的額外投資保費而向持牌保險經紀支付的款項(包括前期及其後的佣金、花紅及其他獎金)。
就定期額外投資保費選擇而言,持牌保險經紀每年實際上可獲取的酬勞金額可能有所不同,而酬勞金額於繳付定期額外投資保
費的首年會較高。此外,此項額外投資保費選擇涉及終生保費供款,計算時總保費及總酬勞金額時採用三十年為供款期的假設。
如果閣下希望進一步了解閣下的持牌保險經紀就此保單可能取得的酬勞,閣下有權向該持牌保險經紀查詢。

results.content_en:
繳費辦法 Payment Instructions
請使用下列辦法直接繳付費用。港元保單只接受港元/澳門元付款。外幣保單可接受以保單貨幣或港元/澳門元付款。非港元保單之付款貨幣受個別繳費方法之條款及細則所規限。
請參閱各繳費方法可接受的付款貨幣。若 閣下以港元/澳門元支付外幣保單及以非支票方式付款,交易金額將按交易日適用的匯率折算為保單貨幣等值金額結算。若 閣下以港元
支票付款,將按保誠收到支票當日的適用匯率換算成保單貨幣的等值金額結算。請瀏覽prudential.com.hk/exchange-rates-mac以獲取不同貨幣的現行匯率。為保障 閣下的利益,
繳付費用時, 閣下不應該將現金轉交或轉賬至 閣下的理財顧問。與此同時,請參閱本公司網頁所刊登之私隱政策。
Please make payments to us directly using the payment methods listed below. For HKD policies, payments can only be made in HKD/MOP. For policies denominated in foreign currencies, payments
can be made in either the policy currency or HKD/MOP. The payment currency of non-HKD policies is subject to the terms and conditions of the individual payment methods. Please refer to the
acceptable payment currencies for each payment method. If you pay for a foreign currency policy in HKD/MOP by non-cheque payment, the transaction amount will be settled at the applicable
exchange rate on the transaction date and converted into the equivalent amount of policy currency. If you pay by cheque in HKD, the transaction amount will be settled at the applicable exchange
rate at on the day of receipt by Prudential and converted into the equivalent amount of policy currency. Please visit prudential.com.hk/exchange-rates-mac-en for our prevailing exchange rate in
different currencies. To protect your interest, you should not pass cash or transfer funds to your financial consultant when making payment. In addition, please visit our privacy policy published in our
corporate website.
3 自動轉賬 Autopay^
閣下可以設立銀行戶口自動轉賬或更改
自動轉賬戶口繳費。請
● 聯絡 閣下之理財顧問或
● 於 www.prudential.com.mo
(澳門>下載中心>更改保單付款
資料)下載的銀行戶口直接付款授權
書(澳門適用)
由於設立自動轉賬需時21天,請將授權
書及預繳保費的支票郵寄至本公司辦理
相關手續(地址:澳門郵政總局郵政信
箱3093號)。
You can set up a bank account autopay or change
autopay account to settle payment. Please
· contact your financial consultant or
· visit www.prudential.com.mo
(Macau > Download library > Update of
Policy Payment Details) for downloading
appropriate Bank Account Direct Debit
Authorization Form (for Macau).
As it takes 21 days to set up the direct debit
authorization, please send the form and the
cheque for advanced payment to us by mail for
processing (Address: P.O. Box 3093, General Post
Office, Macau).
$
電滙 Telegraphic Transfer
您可以使用電匯以保單貨幣 ** 匯款至 You may pay premium by telegraphic transfer
相應貨幣的銀行戶口繳交保費。請預 in policy currency ** to the bank account in
留至少七個工作天以處理有關款項。 the corresponding currency. Please allow
詳情請聯絡 閣下的理財顧問或前往 at least seven working days for processing
pruhk.co/payment-mac-tt °
the premium payment. For details, please
contact your financial consultant or visit
pruhk.co/payment-mac-tt-en.
?其他繳款辦法 Other Payment Instructions
請瀏覽 www.prudential.com.mo 以了解詳情。
Please visit www.prudential.com.mo for details.
親臨繳費處付款 Payment in person at cashier # ▲
閣下可攜同繳費通知書前往本公司之繳費 You can bring along the Premium Notice and
處以下列方法付款。
make payment at our cashier using one of the
following methods.
現金
每份保單每期繳費的交易金額上限為
120,000港元/123,700澳門元/15,000美元
或等值。為保障您的利益,繳付費用時,
您不應該將現金轉交或轉賬至您的理財顧
問。如您欲以現金繳費,建議親臨本公司
繳費處直接辦理。
Cash
Maximum HKD 120,000 / MOP 123,700 /
USD 15,000 or equivalent per payment
installment per policy. To protect your interest,
you should not pass cash or transfer funds
to your financial consultant when making
payment. If you prefer to pay in cash, you
should pay directly at our cashier.
劃線支票/銀行本票/匯票 **
只接受澳門本地銀行發出的港元*劃線支
票/銀行本票/匯票繳費,抬頭請寫上「保
誠保險有限公司」。如閣下於過去12個
月曾使用銀行本票/匯票支付保費及累計
金額超過120,000港元或以上,須付上相
關的資金來源證明文件。有關資金來源証
明文件的詳情,請聯絡您的理財顧問或致
電客戶服務熱線。保誠保留權利以要求客
戶提供有關證明文件。
Crossed cheque/cashier order/bank draft **
Only accept HKD* crossed Cheque/cashier
order/bank draft issued by banks in Macau
made payable to "Prudential Hong Kong
Limited". If you have paid premium by cashier
order/bank draft in the past 12 months and the
total amount exceeds HKD 120,000 or above,
relevant supporting documents for the source
of funds must be provided. Please contact your
financial consultant or call our customer service
hotline for details of the supporting documents.
Prudential reserves the right to request for the
related supporting documents from customers.
信用卡/銀聯卡
請注意,本公司不接受以信用卡/銀聯卡繳
付「續保保費」、「保單更改」、「償還
貸款」及「在保單保費儲蓄戶口的預繳保
費」。
Credit Card/UnionPay Card
Please note that we do not accept payment
by credit card for "Renewal Premium", "Policy
Change", "Loan Repayment" and "Advance
Premium into Premium Deposit Account
(PDA)".
保誠可能隨時更改繳費安排而毋須事先通知。詳情請瀏覽本公司網頁。
Prudential may change payment arrangement anytime without prior notice. For details,
please visit our corporate website.
註 Note:
*
請預留三個工作天予本公司處理有關付款。Please allow 3 working days for payment processing.
** 付款貨幣受個別計劃之條款及細則所規限。Currency for payment is subject to the terms and conditions of individual product.
# 恕不接受以海外支票/銀行本票/匯票繳費。Making payment via overseas cheque/cashier's order/bank draft is not accepted.
▲ 由第三者付款的繳費方式恕不獲接受,除非付款人為保單持有人之直系親屬或指定人士類別,並連同付款人及保單持有人所簽署的「第三者付款聲明書」一併提交。如第
三者款項超過指定金額,第三者付款人必須遞交相關的證明文件。Payment by a third party is not accepted unless the payor is an immediate family member of the policyowner or
person(s) in the specified categories, and the payment is submitted together with a "Third Party Payment Declaration Form" signed by both the payor and the policyowner. If the third party
payment is over designated amount, the payor has to submit the related supporting documents.
(10 / 2024)

order/bank draft issued by banks in Macau
made payable to "Prudential Hong Kong
Limited". If you have paid premium by cashier
order/bank draft in the past 12 months and the
total amount exceeds HKD 120,000 or above,
relevant supporting documents for the source
of funds must be provided. Please contact your
financial consultant or call our customer service
hotline for details of the supporting documents.
Prudential reserves the right to request for the
related supporting documents from customers.

請注意,本公司不接受以信用卡/銀聯卡繳
付「續保保費」、「保單更改」、「償還
貸款」及「在保單保費儲蓄戶口的預繳保
費」。
Credit Card/UnionPay Card
Please note that we do not accept payment
by credit card for "Renewal Premium", "Policy
Change", "Loan Repayment" and "Advance
Premium into Premium Deposit Account
(PDA)".
保誠可能隨時更改繳費安排而毋須事先通知。詳情請瀏覽本公司網頁。
Prudential may change payment arrangement anytime without prior notice. For details,
please visit our corporate website.

*
請預留三個工作天予本公司處理有關付款。Please allow 3 working days for payment processing.
** 付款貨幣受個別計劃之條款及細則所規限。Currency for payment is subject to the terms and conditions of individual product.
# 恕不接受以海外支票/銀行本票/匯票繳費。Making payment via overseas cheque/cashier's order/bank draft is not accepted.

三者款項超過指定金額,第三者付款人必須遞交相關的證明文件。Payment by a third party is not accepted unless the payor is an immediate family member of the policyowner or
person(s) in the specified categories, and the payment is submitted together with a "Third Party Payment Declaration Form" signed by both the payor and the policyowner. If the third party
payment is over designated amount, the payor has to submit the related supporting documents.

繳費辦法 Payment Instructions
請使用下列辦法直接繳付費用。港元保單只接受港元/澳門元付款。外幣保單可接受以保單貨幣或港元/澳門元付款。非港元保單之付款貨幣受個別繳費方法之條款及細則所規限。
請參閱各繳費方法可接受的付款貨幣。若 閣下以港元/澳門元支付外幣保單及以非支票方式付款,交易金額將按交易日適用的匯率折算為保單貨幣等值金額結算。若 閣下以港元
支票付款,將按保誠收到支票當日的適用匯率換算成保單貨幣的等值金額結算。請瀏覽prudential.com.hk/exchange-rates-mac以獲取不同貨幣的現行匯率。為保障 閣下的利益,
繳付費用時, 閣下不應該將現金轉交或轉賬至 閣下的理財顧問。與此同時,請參閱本公司網頁所刊登之私隱政策。
Please make payments to us directly using the payment methods listed below. For HKD policies, payments can only be made in HKD/MOP. For policies denominated in foreign currencies, payments
can be made in either the policy currency or HKD/MOP. The payment currency of non-HKD policies is subject to the terms and conditions of the individual payment methods. Please refer to the
acceptable payment currencies for each payment method. If you pay for a foreign currency policy in HKD/MOP by non-cheque payment, the transaction amount will be settled at the applicable
exchange rate on the transaction date and converted into the equivalent amount of policy currency. If you pay by cheque in HKD, the transaction amount will be settled at the applicable exchange
rate at on the day of receipt by Prudential and converted into the equivalent amount of policy currency. Please visit prudential.com.hk/exchange-rates-mac-en for our prevailing exchange rate in
different currencies. To protect your interest, you should not pass cash or transfer funds to your financial consultant when making payment. In addition, please visit our privacy policy published in our
corporate website.

17. Third Party Right
A person or entity who is not a party to this Policy shall have no rights under the
Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Ordinance (Cap. 623 of the Laws of Hong Kong)
to enforce any terms of this Policy.
20PRUDENTIAL
保 誠 保 險
CLAUSES AND WARRANTIES (For PRUChoice Home, Home Deluxe, Home Landlord)
(Unless expressly mentioned in the Policy Schedule hereto the Clauses enumerated below Form No Part of The Terms and
Conditions of This Policy)
Clause No.
A. 13
Mortgagee Clause
A. 19
Reinstatement Value Insurance Clause
Loss if any under this policy shall be payable to the Mortgagee/s Assignee/s named in the Schedule of the Policy to the extent of their
interest.
It is hereby agreed that in the event of loss or damage the Company will pay the Mortgagees or said Assignees to the extent of their
interest but not exceeding the sum insured or the reinstatement value (less depreciation if any) of the property insured whichever is
lower and that this insurance in so far as concerns the interest therein of the Mortgagees or said Assignees only shall not be invalidated by
any act or neglect of the Mortgagor or Owner of the property insured nor by anything whereby the risk is increased being done to upon
or in any building hereby insured without the knowledge of the Mortgagees or said Assignees provided always that the Mortgagees or
said Assignees shall notify the Company of any change of ownership or alteration or increase of hazard not permitted by this insurance so
soon as any such change alteration or increase shall come to their knowledge and on demand shall pay to the Company the appropriate
additional premium from the time when such increase of risk first took place.
And it is further agreed that whenever the Company shall pay the Mortgagees or said Assignees any sum for loss or damage under this
policy and shall claim that as to the Mortgagor or Owner no liability therefore existed the Company shall at once be legally subrogated to
all rights of the Mortgagees or said Assignees to the extent of such payment and the Mortgagees or said Assignees shall do and execute
all such further or other acts deeds transfers assignments instruments and things as may be necessary or be reasonably required by the
Company for the purpose of better effecting such subrogation but such subrogation shall not impair the right of the Mortgagees or said
Assignees to recover the full amount of their claim.
Provided that as between the Company and the Mortgagor or Owner of the property insured nothing contained in the clause shall in
any way constitute or be deemed to constitute any waiver of or prejudice or affect any rights which the Company may have against the
Mortgagor or Owner of the property insured or lessen any obligations which may be imposed on the Mortgagor or Owner of the property
insured either by or under this policy or by law and such rights and obligations shall as between the Company and the Mortgagor or
Owner of the property insured remain in full force and effect.
The Company reserves the right to cancel this policy at any time as provided by the terms thereof but in such case this policy shall
continue in force for the benefit only of the Mortgagees or said Assignees for 10 days after notice to the Mortgagees or said Assignees
of such cancellation and shall then cease and the Company shall have the right on like notice to cancel this agreement.
It is hereby agreed that in the event of property insured under Building Section of the within policy being destroyed or damaged the basis
upon which the amount payable under (each of the said Section of) the policy is to be calculated shall be reinstatement of the property
destroyed or damaged subject to the following special provisions and subject also to the terms and conditions of the policy except in so
far as the same may be varied hereby.
For the purposes of the insurance under this memorandum 'reinstatement' shall mean :-
The carrying out of the aftermentioned work namely :
(a)
Where property is destroyed the re-building of the property if a building or in the case of other property its replacement by
similar property in either case in a condition equal to but not better or more extensive than its condition when new.
(b)
Where property is damaged the repair of the damage and the restoration of the damaged portion of the property to a condition
substantially the same as but not better or more extensive than its condition when new.
Special Provisions
1.
The work of reinstatement (which may be carried out upon another site and in any manner suitable to the requirements of
the Insured subject to the liability of the Company not being thereby increased) must be commenced and carried out with
reasonable dispatch; otherwise no payment beyond the amount which would have been payable under the policy if this
memorandum had not been incorporated therein shall be made.
2.
When any property insured under this memorandum is damaged or destroyed in part only the liability of the Company shall
not exceed the sum representing the cost which the Company could have been called upon to pay for reinstatement if such
property had been wholly destroyed.
3.
No payment beyond the amount which would have been payable under the policy if this memorandum had not been
incorporated therein shall be made until the cost of reinstatement shall have been actually incurred.
4.
Each item insured under this memorandum is declared to be separately subject to the following Condition of Average namely:
If at the time of reinstatement the sum representing the cost which would have been incurred in reinstatement if the whole of
the property covered by such item had been destroyed exceeds the sum insured thereon at the breaking out of any fire or at the
commencement of any destruction of or damage to such property by any other peril hereby insured against then the Insured
shall be considered as being his own insured for the excess and shall bear a ratable proportion of the loss accordingly.
GI3/PO0024E/P01 (03/17)

results.title_name_tc: 保誠精選「家居寶」
results.content_en:
國際仲裁中心機構仲裁規則》最
終解決。本仲裁條款適用的法律為香港法。仲裁地應為香港。仲裁員
人數為一名。仲裁程式應按照英文來進行。若本公司拒絕就本保單項
下的任何索賠向受保人承擔責任,而受保人並無把該項索賠在拒絕該
項索賠起計十二個月內根據本仲裁條款提交仲裁,則就各方面而言該
項索賠將被視為已經放棄及不能追討。
17. 其他保險
倘若受本保單所保障的事件發生時(項目六-「家居意外保障」提供
的死亡及完全永久傷殘保障則除外),有其他保單保障相同或部份相
同責任時,本公司將不會就該事件支付多於按比例計算而應付之金
額。就項目五-「第三者法律責任保障」及其額外保障而言,本保單
只應在其他保險未能作出償付的情況下作出賠償,並不應用作分擔任
何損失。
18. 第三方權利
任何不是本保單某一方的人士或實體,不能根據《合約(第三者權利)
條例》(香港法例第623章)強制執行本保單的任何條款。
19. 佔優
本保單條款內容以中文及英文載錄。倘若中文內容及英文內容互有衝
突或不一致之處,均以英文內容為準。
20
重要事項:受保人需閱讀本保單。如發現本保單有錯誤或遺漏之處,請將本保單送回本公司,以作更改。PRUDENTIAL
保 誠 保 險
CLAUSES AND WARRANTIES (For PRUChoice Home, Home Deluxe, Home Landlord)
(Unless expressly mentioned in the Policy Schedule hereto the Clauses enumerated below Form No Part of The Terms and
Conditions of This Policy)
Clause No.
A. 13
Mortgagee Clause
A. 19
Reinstatement Value Insurance Clause
Loss if any under this policy shall be payable to the Mortgagee/s Assignee/s named in the Schedule of the Policy to the extent of their
interest.
It is hereby agreed that in the event of loss or damage the Company will pay the Mortgagees or said Assignees to the extent of their
interest but not exceeding the sum insured or the reinstatement value (less depreciation if any) of the property insured whichever is
lower and that this insurance in so far as concerns the interest therein of the Mortgagees or said Assignees only shall not be invalidated by
any act or neglect of the Mortgagor or Owner of the property insured nor by anything whereby the risk is increased being done to upon
or in any building hereby insured without the knowledge of the Mortgagees or said Assignees provided always that the Mortgagees or
said Assignees shall notify the Company of any change of ownership or alteration or increase of hazard not permitted by this insurance so
soon as any such change alteration or increase shall come to their knowledge and on demand shall pay to the Company the appropriate
additional premium from the time when such increase of risk first took place.
And it is further agreed that whenever the Company shall pay the Mortgagees or said Assignees any sum for loss or damage under this
policy and shall claim that as to the Mortgagor or Owner no liability therefore existed the Company shall at once be legally subrogated to
all rights of the Mortgagees or said Assignees to the extent of such payment and the Mortgagees or said Assignees shall do and execute
all such further or other acts deeds transfers assignments instruments and things as may be necessary or be reasonably required by the
Company for the purpose of better effecting such subrogation but such subrogation shall not impair the right of the Mortgagees or said
Assignees to recover the full amount of their claim.
Provided that as between the Company and the Mortgagor or Owner of the property insured nothing contained in the clause shall in
any way constitute or be deemed to constitute any waiver of or prejudice or affect any rights which the Company may have against the
Mortgagor or Owner of the property insured or lessen any obligations which may be imposed on the Mortgagor or Owner of the property
insured either by or under this policy or by law and such rights and obligations shall as between the Company and the Mortgagor or
Owner of the property insured remain in full force and effect.
The Company reserves the right to cancel this policy at any time as provided by the terms thereof but in such case this policy shall
continue in force for the benefit only of the Mortgagees or said Assignees for 10 days after notice to the Mortgagees or said Assignees
of such cancellation and shall then cease and the Company shall have the right on like notice to cancel this agreement.
It is hereby agreed that in the event of property insured under Building Section of the within policy being destroyed or damaged the basis
upon which the amount payable under (each of the said Section of) the policy is to be calculated shall be reinstatement of the property
destroyed or damaged subject to the following special provisions and subject also to the terms and conditions of the policy except in so
far as the same may be varied hereby.
For the purposes of the insurance under this memorandum 'reinstatement' shall mean :-
The carrying out of the aftermentioned work namely :
(a)
Where property is destroyed the re-building of the property if a building or in the case of other property its replacement by
similar property in either case in a condition equal to but not better or more extensive than its condition when new.
(b)
Where property is damaged the repair of the damage and the restoration of the damaged portion of the property to a condition
substantially the same as but not better or more extensive than its condition when new.
Special Provisions
1.
The work of reinstatement (which may be carried out upon another site and in any manner suitable to the requirements of
the Insured subject to the liability of the Company not being thereby increased) must be commenced and carried out with
reasonable dispatch; otherwise no payment beyond the amount which would have been payable under the policy if this
memorandum had not been incorporated therein shall be made.
2.
When any property insured under this memorandum is damaged or destroyed in part only the liability of the Company shall
not exceed the sum representing the cost which the Company could have been called upon to pay for reinstatement if such
property had been wholly destroyed.
3.
No payment beyond the amount which would have been payable under the policy if this memorandum had not been
incorporated therein shall be made until the cost of reinstatement shall have been actually incurred.
4.
Each item insured under this memorandum is declared to be separately subject to the following Condition of Average namely:
If at the time of reinstatement the sum representing the cost which would have been incurred in reinstatement if the whole of
the property covered by such item had been destroyed exceeds the sum insured thereon at the breaking out of any fire or at the
commencement of any destruction of or damage to such property by any other peril hereby insured against then the Insured
shall be considered as being his own insured for the excess and shall bear a ratable proportion of the loss accordingly.
GI3/PO0024E/P01 (03/17)

下的任何索賠向受保人承擔責任,而受保人並無把該項索賠在拒絕該
項索賠起計十二個月內根據本仲裁條款提交仲裁,則就各方面而言該

on the Certificate of Insurance or particular endorsement.
This Insurance is not valid for travel exceeding 120 days.
This Policy shall cease to be in force if there be any alternation in Business or Occupation of the
Insured Person for more than 6 months unless the Company by endorsement declares the Insurance
to be continued.
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy
should be returned to the issuing office for correction.
15VI.
Fraud
VII.
Claims
VIII
Non-transfer of Insured's Rights
IX.
Company's Right
X.
Premium
XI.
XII.
Jurisdiction
If any claim shall be fraudulent or intentionally exaggerated or if any false declaration or statement
shall be made then this Policy shall be void and no claim shall be payable.
(a) Advise the Company in writing immediately but in all cases not later than 31 days from the date of
return to Hong Kong after the incident. In case of death claim, advise the Company within 7 days
immediately after the death together with the supporting documents including death certificate
letter of administration estate duty clearance letter and post-mortem report.
(b) Furnish all certificates information and evidence required by the Company at the expense of the
Insured Person or his/her legal personal representatives.
(c) Not admit any liability on behalf of the Company or to give any representations or other
undertakings binding upon the Company except with the Company's written consent.
(d) In case of death where any reasonable doubt exists as to the cause thereof a qualified and
Registered Medical Practitioner appointed by the Company shall be allowed to make post-
mortem examination of the body of the Insured Person at the Company's expense.
Unless otherwise expressly stated nothing contained herein shall give any rights against the Company
to any person other than the Insured. Further the Company shall not be bound by any passing of the
interest of the Insured otherwise than by death or operation of law unless and until the Company shall
by endorsement declare the Policy to be continued. The extension of the claim under this Policy to
such person the intention being that the Insured shall in all cases claim for and on behalf of such
person and the receipt of the Insured shall in any case absolutely discharge the Company's liability
under this Policy in respect of such loss.
The Company shall be entitled to conduct in the name and on behalf of the Insured Person the
defense or settlement of any legal action and take proceedings at the Company's own expenses and
for the Company's own benefit but in the name of the Insured Person to recover compensation from
any third party in respect of anything covered by this Policy and to instruct solicitors of the Company's
own choice for this purpose.
In the event of the death of the Insured Person the Company shall have the right to have a post
In all other circumstances, no refund of premium is allowed once the Insurance has become effective.
Renewal
The Policy will be renewed on a yearly basis upon receipt of the confirmation from the Insured Person
and the successful premium collection for the renewal of the coming year.
If the payment method is yearly by credit card this Policy will be renewed automatically and premium
for the renewal of the coming year will be collected on the collection date of renewal from the Insured
Person's nominated account automatically.
The Policy will not be renewable after the end of Period of Insurance during which the Insured Person
has attained the age of 76.
This Policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Hong Kong. The parties
agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of Hong Kong Court.
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy
should be returned to the issuing office for correction.

The Company shall be entitled to conduct in the name and on behalf of the Insured Person the
defense or settlement of any legal action and take proceedings at the Company's own expenses and
for the Company's own benefit but in the name of the Insured Person to recover compensation from
any third party in respect of anything covered by this Policy and to instruct solicitors of the Company's
own choice for this purpose.
In the event of the death of the Insured Person the Company shall have the right to have a post
In all other circumstances, no refund of premium is allowed once the Insurance has become effective.
Renewal
The Policy will be renewed on a yearly basis upon receipt of the confirmation from the Insured Person
and the successful premium collection for the renewal of the coming year.
If the payment method is yearly by credit card this Policy will be renewed automatically and premium
for the renewal of the coming year will be collected on the collection date of renewal from the Insured
Person's nominated account automatically.
The Policy will not be renewable after the end of Period of Insurance during which the Insured Person
has attained the age of 76.
This Policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Hong Kong. The parties
agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of Hong Kong Court.
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy
should be returned to the issuing office for correction.
16

results.content_en:
on the Certificate of Insurance or particular endorsement.
This Insurance is not valid for travel exceeding 120 days.
This Policy shall cease to be in force if there be any alternation in Business or Occupation of the
Insured Person for more than 6 months unless the Company by endorsement declares the Insurance
to be continued.
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy
should be returned to the issuing office for correction.
15VI.
Fraud
VII.
Claims
VIII
Non-transfer of Insured's Rights
IX.
Company's Right
X.
Premium
XI.
XII.
Jurisdiction
If any claim shall be fraudulent or intentionally exaggerated or if any false declaration or statement
shall be made then this Policy shall be void and no claim shall be payable.
(a) Advise the Company in writing immediately but in all cases not later than 31 days from the date of
return to Hong Kong after the incident. In case of death claim, advise the Company within 7 days
immediately after the death together with the supporting documents including death certificate
letter of administration estate duty clearance letter and post-mortem report.
(b) Furnish all certificates information and evidence required by the Company at the expense of the
Insured Person or his/her legal personal representatives.
(c) Not admit any liability on behalf of the Company or to give any representations or other
undertakings binding upon the Company except with the Company's written consent.
(d) In case of death where any reasonable doubt exists as to the cause thereof a qualified and
Registered Medical Practitioner appointed by the Company shall be allowed to make post-
mortem examination of the body of the Insured Person at the Company's expense.
Unless otherwise expressly stated nothing contained herein shall give any rights against the Company
to any person other than the Insured. Further the Company shall not be bound by any passing of the
interest of the Insured otherwise than by death or operation of law unless and until the Company shall
by endorsement declare the Policy to be continued. The extension of the claim under this Policy to
such person the intention being that the Insured shall in all cases claim for and on behalf of such
person and the receipt of the Insured shall in any case absolutely discharge the Company's liability
under this Policy in respect of such loss.
The Company shall be entitled to conduct in the name and on behalf of the Insured Person the
defense or settlement of any legal action and take proceedings at the Company's own expenses and
for the Company's own benefit but in the name of the Insured Person to recover compensation from
any third party in respect of anything covered by this Policy and to instruct solicitors of the Company's
own choice for this purpose.
In the event of the death of the Insured Person the Company shall have the right to have a post
mortem at the Company's own expenses.
In all other circumstances, no refund of premium is allowed once the Insurance has become effective.
Renewal
The Policy will be renewed on a yearly basis upon receipt of the confirmation from the Insured Person
and the successful premium collection for the renewal of the coming year.
If the payment method is yearly by credit card this Policy will be renewed automatically and premium
for the renewal of the coming year will be collected on the collection date of renewal from the Insured
Person's nominated account automatically.
The Policy will not be renewable after the end of Period of Insurance during which the Insured Person
has attained the age of 76.
This Policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Hong Kong. The parties
agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of Hong Kong Court.
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy
should be returned to the issuing office for correction.

letter of administration estate duty clearance letter and post-mortem report.
(b) Furnish all certificates information and evidence required by the Company at the expense of the
Insured Person or his/her legal personal representatives.
(c) Not admit any liability on behalf of the Company or to give any representations or other
undertakings binding upon the Company except with the Company's written consent.
(d) In case of death where any reasonable doubt exists as to the cause thereof a qualified and
Registered Medical Practitioner appointed by the Company shall be allowed to make post-
mortem examination of the body of the Insured Person at the Company's expense.
Unless otherwise expressly stated nothing contained herein shall give any rights against the Company
to any person other than the Insured. Further the Company shall not be bound by any passing of the
interest of the Insured otherwise than by death or operation of law unless and until the Company shall
by endorsement declare the Policy to be continued. The extension of the claim under this Policy to
such person the intention being that the Insured shall in all cases claim for and on behalf of such
person and the receipt of the Insured shall in any case absolutely discharge the Company's liability
under this Policy in respect of such loss.
The Company shall be entitled to conduct in the name and on behalf of the Insured Person the
defense or settlement of any legal action and take proceedings at the Company's own expenses and
for the Company's own benefit but in the name of the Insured Person to recover compensation from
any third party in respect of anything covered by this Policy and to instruct solicitors of the Company's
own choice for this purpose.
In the event of the death of the Insured Person the Company shall have the right to have a post
mortem at the Company's own expenses.
In all other circumstances, no refund of premium is allowed once the Insurance has become effective.
Renewal
The Policy will be renewed on a yearly basis upon receipt of the confirmation from the Insured Person
and the successful premium collection for the renewal of the coming year.
If the payment method is yearly by credit card this Policy will be renewed automatically and premium
for the renewal of the coming year will be collected on the collection date of renewal from the Insured
Person's nominated account automatically.
The Policy will not be renewable after the end of Period of Insurance during which the Insured Person
has attained the age of 76.
This Policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Hong Kong. The parties
agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of Hong Kong Court.
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy
should be returned to the issuing office for correction.
16

results.title_name_en: Addition/Increase of Regular Top-up Premium (RTU) / Addition of Lump Sum Top-up Premium
results.title_name_tc: 附加/增加定期額外投資保費或附加一次過額外投資保費
results.content_en:
PRUDENTIAL
英 國 保 誠
From :
Anthony Shaw
Date :
8 December, 2014
To :
All Financial Consultants
CC :
Regional Managers & up, Senior Managers & up
Re :
Withdrawal of ILAS Products
To help protect the rights of customers and ensure that the quality of ILAS business issued by the Hong Kong
insurance industry is as high as possible, the Office of the Commissioner of Insurance (OCI) has issued a
Guidance Note on Underwriting Class C Business (GN15), which will be effective on 1 January 2015. The
major scope of GN15 includes requiring a minimum death benefit of 105% of the account value, ensuring fees
and charges are fair to customers and remuneration structure is appropriate with proper disclosure.
Our current ILAS products do not conform to the new standards contained in GN15. In view of this, the
Company will withdraw the following products with effect from 1 January 2015 i.e. these products will be
removed from the PRUcompass on 1 January 2015:
· PRUlink investment plan(PLIP)
PRUretirement extra(RP3)
· PRUkid extra(KIDS2)
· PRUlink optimiser plus(POP2)
PRUlink investlife(IL1)
· Investment Plus (INVP)
Please note, PRUlink capital investment plan (PCI) is in compliance with the new regulatory requirements and
will continue to be available for sale on or after 1 January 2015.
To comply with the new regulatory requirements, please note that all completed applications* for PLIP,
RP3, KIDS2, POP2, IL1 and any traditional plans attached with INVP must reach the Cashier Office no
later than 16:00 on 31 December 2014 (the last submission date). All New Business premium and
outstanding supporting documents (if any) must be submitted as soon as possible for policy issue. The
Company will cancel all unsuccessful applications by 31 January 2015 (the last issue date).
For any addition of INVP rider, the completed application* must reach relevant PA Drop-In Box before
14:00 on 31 December 2014 (the last submission date). All outstanding premiums and documents (if any)
must be submitted as soon as possible for company approval. The Company will cancel all unsuccessful
applications by 31 January 2015 (the last issue date).
* Complete application means:
(1) Application Form / Application for Change in Policy and all other relevant application documents are properly signed and
completed; and
(2) Sales illustration must be printed and duly signed on or before 31 December 2014.
To meet customer demand for ILAS products, PLIP and POP2 will be revamped and the new products will be
available in January 2015 subject to regulatory approval. Details will be announced later.
Best regards,
Anthony Shaw
Chief Officer, Marketing & Customer Service

results.title_name_tc: 保誠精選「興業寶」
results.content_en:

and expense (Applicable to SECTION V)
as so provided in the Policy directly or indirectly caused by resulting from or in
connection with any of the following:
Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary, this insurance excludes any
loss, damage, liability, expense, fines, penalties or any other amount directly or
4
IMPORTANT - the Insured is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the issuing Office for correction.indirectly caused by, in connection with, or in any way involving or arising out
of any of the following including any fear or threat thereof, whether actual or
perceived:
· Coronavirus (COVID-19) including any mutation or variation thereof; or
· any declaration, categorisation, characterisation, reference to or in any
other way communication as an epidemic or pandemic by the World Health
Organisation or other governmental or quasi-governmental public health
agency, entity or service that may make such declaration.
8) Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary within this Insurance or any
endorsement thereto it is agreed that the Company shall not be deemed to
provide cover and the Company shall not be liable to pay any claim or provide
any benefit hereunder to the extent that the provision of such cover payment
of such claim or provision of such benefit would expose the Company to any
sanction prohibition or restriction under United Nations resolutions or the
trade or economic sanctions laws or regulations of the European Union United
Kingdom or United States of America.
DEFINITIONS
“Insured"
The party named as the Insured in the Schedule and no others.
"Business"
The usual work and activities carried on by the Insured pertaining to his/ her business
as specified in the Schedule and no others.
"Communicable Disease"
Means any disease which can be transmitted by means of any substance or agent
from any organism to another organism where:
i)
the substance or agent includes, but is not limited to, a virus, bacterium, parasite
or other organism or any variation thereof, whether deemed living or not, and
ii) the method of transmission, whether direct or indirect, includes but is not limited
to, airborne transmission, bodily fluid transmission, transmission from or to any
surface or object, solid, liquid or gas or between organisms, and
iii) the disease, substance or agent can cause or threaten damage to human health
or human welfare or can cause or threaten damage to, deterioration of, loss of
value of, marketability of or loss of use of property.
"Office Premises"
The premises occupied by the Insured as an Office at the situation shown in the
Schedule at which the Business of the Insured as specified in the Schedule is
transacted and is all built of brick stone and concrete and roofed with concrete.
"Office Contents"
Contents belonging to the Insured or for which the Insured is legally responsible all
used in connection with the Business and contained in the Office Premises including
but not limited to:
1. any telephone installation, gas and electricity meters
2.
interior decorations and improvements made by the Insured
3. landlord's fixtures and fittings wallpapers ceilings panellings and the like but only
to the extent for which the Insured is legally liable to the landlord as tenant.
"Personal Effects"
Property of personal use normally worn or used and in either case carried about the
person in everyday life but excluding Money spectacles and contact lenses.
"Employee"
S
Any person in the employ of the Insured as defined in the Employees' Compensation
Ordinance.
“Money"
Cash currency notes bank-notes postal and money orders cheques negotiable
instruments postage and revenue stamps not forming part of a stamp collection
travel tickets and luncheon vouchers all pertaining to the Business and belonging
to the Insured.
"Business Hours"
The usual hours during which the Insured transacts Business at the Office Premises
and during which the Insured the Insured's partners directors or Employees normally
entrusted with Money shall be actually in or on the Office Premises.
"Permanent Total"
Absolute disablement from engaging in or giving attention to any gainful occupation
for twelve calendar months and at the end of that time being beyond hope of
improvement.
"Loss of Limb Disablement"
Loss by physical severance or total and permanent loss of use of a hand at or above
the wrist or of a foot at or above the ankle.
"Accident"
For the purpose of Section VI, accident means an accident or a series of accidents
arising out of one event.
“Disease"
A disease contracted by an Employee of the Insured as a result of his/ her exposure to
the nature of his/ her employment with the Insured. Such exposure may extend over
a period of time and part of which period may fall outside the Period of Insurance
under this Policy.
"Earnings"
All gross wages salaries remunerations commissions bonuses overtime termination
payments allowances and the like director's fees or other benefits whether at
piecework rates or otherwise and whether paid in cash or in kind by the Insured to
his/ her Employees.
"Noise-Induced Deafness"
Has the same meaning as assigned to that expression in the Occupational Deafness
(Compensation) Ordinance (Chapter 469 of the laws of Hong Kong).
"Ordinance"
The Employees' Compensation Ordinance (Chapter 282 of the laws of Hong Kong).
"Pneumoconiosis and Mesothelioma"
Have the same meaning as assigned to those expressions in the Pneumoconiosis and
Mesothelioma (Compensation) Ordinance (Chapter 360 of the laws of Hong Kong).
"Geographical Area"
For the purpose of Section VI, geographical area means the territory of Hong Kong.
"Damage/ Damage to Office Contents/ Property/ Safe or Strongroom/ Office
Premises/ Building/ Land or Structure"
Property damage covered under this Insurance shall mean physical damage to the
substance of property.
Physical damage to the substance of property shall not include damage to data or
software in particular any detrimental change in data software or computer programs
that is caused by a deletion a corruption or a deformation of the original structure.
Consequently the following are excluded from this Insurance:
a)
loss of or damage to data or software in particular any detrimental change in
data software or computer programs that is caused by a deletion a corruption
or a deformation of the original structure and any business interruption losses
resulting from such loss or damage. Notwithstanding this Definition loss of or
damage to data or software which is the direct consequence of insured physical
damage to the substance of property shall be covered.
b) loss or damage resulting from an impairment in the function availability range
of use or accessibility of data software or computer programs and any business
interruption losses resulting from such loss or damage.
CONDITIONS
1) Interpretation
This Policy and the Schedule shall be read together as one contract and any word
or expression to which a specific meaning has been attached in any part of this
Policy or of the Schedule shall bear such meaning wherever it may appear.
2)
Alterations
The Insured shall give immediate written notice to the Company of any alteration
which materially affects the risks covered by this Policy.
3)
Basis of Settlement
The Company will pay the cost price following any loss to sample or trade stock
under Section I. Claims for other Office Contents under Section I (including its
Extensions) will be settled without deduction for wear tear and depreciation
except claims for clothing office linen provided that costs have been incurred
only for replacement or reinstatement in a condition similar to but not better
than new.
4)
Pair and Set Clause
Where any insured item consists of articles in a pair or set this Policy is not to pay
more than the value of any particular part or parts which may be lost without
reference to any special value which such article or articles may have as part of
such pair or set nor more than a proportionate part of the insured value of the
pair or set.
IMPORTANT - the Insured is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the issuing Office for correction.
5

HK$ 10,000 any one item
- 10% of the Sum Insured of the
Section in total
d) Work of art
- HK$ 10,000 any one set
- 10% of the Sum Insured of the
Section in total
e) Personal Effects belonging to the
Insured and the Insured's Employees
- HK$3,000 any one person
The maximum liability of the Company in respect of all loss or damage under this
Section shall not exceed the Sum Insured as specified against the Section in the
Schedule.
Extensions
Fixed Glass
The Company will pay for accidental breakage of fixed glass in windows doors
fanlights partitions and sanitary ware at the Office Premises and for the reasonable
cost of any temporary boarding-up rendered necessary as a result of the breakage
but not the cost of lettering or decoration on the glass. The liability of the Company
in respect of such benefit is up to HK$20,000 any one year.
Temporary Removal
The Company will pay for the accidental physical loss of or Damage unless otherwise
excepted to the Office Contents (other than sample or trade stock) whilst temporarily
removed from the Office Premises but remaining in other premises within Hong
Kong for the purpose of cleaning renovation, repair or other similar purposes. The
Company's maximum liability for this extra benefit shall not exceed HK$200,000 any
one item and 10% of the Sum Insured of the Section for any one year.
Documents in Transit
This Policy extends the cover for electronic data plans manuscripts deeds files office
records or documents insured under this Section to loss destruction or Damage by
any peril not otherwise excepted whilst they are temporarily removed by the Insured
or the Insured's partners directors Employees but remaining in Hong Kong for an
Cost of Removal of Debris
The Company will also pay for the costs and expenses incurred with the Company's
consent in removing debris of Office Contents following loss or Damage insured
under this Section for an amount not exceeding 10% of the Sum Insured of the
Cost of Recharging Fire Extinguishing Equipment
This Policy extends to cover the cost of recharging fire extinguishing equipment
belonging to the Insured or for which the Insured is responsible following fire or
explosion taking place on the Office Premises. Any costs recoverable from the landlord
is however not covered. The amount shall not exceed HK$5,000 for any one year.
Damage to Office Premises by Burglars
The Company will indemnify the Insured in respect of destruction of or Damage to the
Office Premises for which the Insured is responsible to repair arising out of burglary
or attempted burglary of Office Contents involving forcible and violent entry or exit
from the Office Premises. This extension does not cover any costs recoverable from
the landlord. The amount shall not exceed HK$5,000 per year.
Liquor
The Company will pay for the loss due to accidental breakage to bottle of liquor that
are owned by the insured with cork or cap attached to the bottle neck and not screwed
at the time of damage in insured premises. The company's maximum liability for this
extension shall not exceed HK$ 1,000 per bottle and HK$5,000 per year.
SECTION II - BUSINESS INTERRUPTION
The Company agrees to indemnify the Insured up to HK$500,000 any one year for
additional expenses reasonably and necessarily incurred by the Insured during the
period commencing with the happening of the accident and ceasing not more than
six months later for the sole purpose of avoiding or diminishing any interruption of
or interference with the Business directly resulting from
a) loss of or Damage to the Office Contents insured and payable under Section I
of this Policy.
b)
denial of access to the Office Premises due to prohibition by order of the
Government Authorities or Building Management because of Damage to
Property in vicinity or failure of Public Utilities/ Supplies. The Company shall not
be liable for loss suffered during the first 48 hours immediately following the
denial of access or failure of Public Utilities/ Supplies.
Provided that in ascertaining the amount of such additional expenditure, due
allowance shall be made for
a) any amount recoverable under this and/ or any other insurance for rent, rates
and taxes of the premises and
b) any saving in the ordinary expenditure of the Business which may be effected
in consequence of the Damage.
GI3/PO0008E/P01 (08/21)
IMPORTANT - the Insured is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the issuing Office for correction.
1

results.title_name_tc: 保誠精選「興業寶」
results.content_en:
ere any insured item consists of articles in a pair or set this Policy is not to pay
more than the value of any particular part or parts which may be lost without
reference to any special value which such article or articles may have as part of
such pair or set nor more than a proportionate part of the insured value of the
pair or set.
IMPORTANT - the Insured is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the issuing Office for correction.
55)
Average
If in the event of loss or Damage the Sum Insured shall be less than the full value
of the property insured the Insured shall be considered as being his own insurer
for the difference and shall bear a ratable share of the loss. The Sum Insured by
each and every items of Section I are declared to be separately subject to this
condition. The total amount recoverable in respect of loss or Damage shall not
exceed the Sum Insured.
6)
Automatic Reinstatement
In the event of loss or Damage under Section I the amount payable for such loss
or Damage shall be automatically reinstated from the time of the happening and
the Insured shall pay an appropriate additional premium therefore calculated
pro-rata from the date of loss to the expiration of the Policy.
7)
Precautions
The Insured shall take all ordinary reasonable precautions to prevent accidents
and losses and to comply with all statutory obligations and regulations imposed
by any authority.
8)
Fraud
If any claim shall be fraudulent or intentionally exaggerated or if any false
declaration or statement shall be made then this Policy shall be void and no
claim be payable.
9) Claims
In the event of any happening which may give rise to a claim under this Policy
(a) the Insured shall give immediate notice thereof in writing to the Company
and shall at his/ her own expense furnish to the Company all such certificates
information and evidence in such form and of such nature as the Company
may reasonably require for the purpose of ascertaining its liability as soon
as possible.
(b) the Company shall not be liable if discovery of loss and notification of claim
is not made by the Insured within 31 days of the occurrence. All practicable
steps shall be taken by the Insured to discover and punish the guilty person
or persons and to trace and recover the property lost. The Insured shall
notify the Police immediately upon discovery of any loss being the result
of burglary.
(c) under Section V or VI the Insured shall notify or forward to the Company
every letter claim writ summons or process immediately on receipt.
(d) under Section IV or VI the Insured shall from time to time when required by
the Company submit the injured Employees to be examined by a registered
medical practitioner appointed by the Company. In the case of death
where any reasonable doubt exists as to the cause thereof a registered
medical practitioner appointed by the Company shall be allowed to make
a post-mortem examination of the body of the Employee at the Company's
expenses.
(e) under Section IV or VI the Insured shall ensure that proper medical and
surgical advice is obtained and followed by the Employee affected as soon
as possible after an occurrence.
(f) under Section V the Insured shall not make any admission of liability offer
promise payment or indemnity without the written consent of the Company.
St
10) Salvage
The Company shall have the right to enter the Office Premises where the loss or
Damage has occurred and to take and keep possession of any of the property
11) Subrogation
The Company shall be entitled to take over and conduct in the name of the
Insured the defence or settlement of any claim against the Insured or to
prosecute in the name of the Insured for its own benefit any claim for indemnity
or Damages or otherwise and the Insured shall give all such information and
assistance as the Company may require.
12) Discharge of Liability
At any time after the occurrence of any event giving rise to a claim or claims
against the Insured for which indemnity is provided under Section Vor VI of this
Policy the Company may pay to the Insured the full amount of the Company's
liability specified in the relevant section (after the deduction of any sums already
paid) or any lesser amount for which such claim or claims can be settled and shall
relinquish the conduct of any defence settlement or proceedings relating to such
claim or claims and shall not thereafter be responsible for any compensation
damages or costs in respect thereof or for any costs or expenses whatsoever
incurred by the Insured after the Company shall have relinquished such conduct
or for any loss Damage or expenses caused to the Insured in consequence of
any act or omission of the Company in connection therewith or of the Company
relinquishing such conduct.
13) Non-transfer of Insured's Rights
Unless otherwise expressly stated nothing contained herein shall give any rights
against the Company to any person other than the Insured. Further the Company
shall not bound by any passing of the interest of the Insured otherwise than by
death or operation of law unless and until the Company shall by endorsement
declare the insurance to be continued. The extension of the Company's liability
in respect of the property or liability of any person other than Insured shall give
no right of claim under this Policy to such person the intention being that the
Insured shall in all cases claim for and on behalf of such person and the receipt of
the Insured shall in any case absolutely discharge the Company's liability under
this Policy in respect of such loss. In the event of the death of the Insured the
Company will in respect of any liability incurred by the Insured under Section
V or VI indemnify the Insured's legal personal representatives in the terms of
and subject to the limitations of the Sections concerned provided that such
legal personal representatives shall as though they were the Insured observe
fulfil and be subject to the terms conditions and exceptions of the Policy so far
as they can apply.
14) Jurisdiction
The indemnity under this Policy shall not apply in respect of judgments which
are not in the first instance delivered by or obtained from a court of competent
jurisdiction in Hong Kong.
15) Cancellation
The Company may cancel this Policy by sending seven (7) days' notice by
registered letter to the Insured at his last known address and in such event the
Insured shall be entitled to the return of a proportionate part of the Premium
corresponding to the unexpired portion of the Period of Insurance.
The Insured may cancel this Policy by giving the Company seven (7) days' notice
in writing. In such case the Company will retain the customary short period rate
for the time the Policy has been in force and refund the balance to the Insured
provided that no claim has been made during the current Period of Insurance.
16) Arbitration
All differences arising out of this Policy shall be referred to the decision of an
Arbitrator to be appointed in writing by the parties in difference or if they
cannot agree upon a single Arbitrator to the decision of two Arbitrators one to
be appointed by each of the parties in writing or in case the Arbitrators do not
agree to the decision of an Umpire appointed by the Arbitrators in writing before
entering upon the reference and the making of the award shall be a condition
precedent to any liability of the Company or any right of action against the
Company in respect of any claim.
17) Other Insurances
If at the time of the happening of any occurrence covered by this Policy (except
for the benefit of Section IV) there is any other existing insurance covering the
same liability or any part thereof the Company shall not be liable to pay or
contribute more than its ratable proportion of any sum payable in respect of
such occurrence.
18) Third Party Right
A person or entity who is not a party to this Policy shall have no rights under the
Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Ordinance (Cap. 623 of the Laws of Hong
Kong) to enforce any terms of this Policy.
6
IMPORTANT - the Insured is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the issuing Office for correction.
